publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra (name of God in Text I-1; name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5); titles and numbers of the Pss. and Canticles; name and traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; title of Texts I-2, I-3 and I-5; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; a few words in Texts I-4 and I-5.
Two groups of lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-2 and on the incipit page of every tenth Ps.

list.item:
10
፪II(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 7; 8, stub after 2/fols. 15r-24v)

4 B(4/fols. 188r-191v).
The quire number ፲፱ (XIX) is not correct: according to the sequence of the quires it should be ፲፰ (XVIII).

supportDesc.condition: The leather cover is damaged at the upper and bottom part of the spine. Holes carefully amended on fols. 43, 46, 91, 92, 104, 108, 174, 175, 176, 178.

layout.ab: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data are for fol. 6r.
The number of lines is regular.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Texts I-4, I-5: all data for fol. 170r.
The number of lines is regular.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handDesc.handNote: sometimes it is written also with a vertical stroke attached to the bottom of it (e.g., fols. 5r, l.3, 76v, l.6, 93r, l.11).

decoDesc.decoNote: - Fol. 5r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, green, light blue and white) ornamental band, at the incipit of Ps. 1, with four lateral pendants at the corners, reaching l.5 and reaching the top of the page; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, in the middle, a floral motif and, at the lateral sides, a depiction (red, yellow, pink, rose, light blue, green, orange, black and white) of two angels with sword. A legend (in black) is in the upper margin: ገነት፡, “Garden”.

- Fol. 13r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, pink, green and black) ornamental band, at the incipit of Ps. 11, with four lateral pendants at the corners, reaching l.5 and reaching the top of the page; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, at the lateral sides, two floral motifs and, in the middle, a depiction (red, yellow, violet, pale rose, green and black) of king Dawit praying. A legend (in black) is in the upper margin: ዳዊት፡ ስለ፡ ስምንተኛት፡ ሽህ፡ ዘመን፡ እንደ፡ ጸለየ።

- Fol. 21v: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, pink, light blue, green and black) ornamental band, at the incipit of Ps. 21, with six pendants: four at the corners, reaching l.6 and reaching the top of the page, two at the upper and central part of the band; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, in the middle, a depiction (red, yellow, violet, green, pale rose, brown, black and white) of king Dawit with two dogs. A legend (in black; part in Amharic) in the upper margin: ዘከመ፡ አገትዎ፡ ከለባቸ፡ አይሁድ፡ እኩያን፡ ለእግዚእነ።

- Fol. 31r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, blue and green) ornamental band, at the incipit of Ps. 31, with four pendants at the corners, reaching l.5 and reaching the top of the page; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, in the middle, a floral motif and, at the lateral sides, two depictions (red, yellow, violet, blue, black and white) of king Dawit.

- Fol. 43r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, green and black) ornamental band, at the incipit of Ps. 41, with two lateral pendants at the bottom corners reaching l.4; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, at the lateral sides, two floral motifs and, in the middle, a depiction (light blue, white, black, yellow and red) of an ibex which gave birth to a calf. A legend (in black and in Amharic) in the upper margin:
ዋልያ፡, “ibex”.

- Fol. 52r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, blue and green) ornamental band at the incipit of Ps. 51, with four pendants at the corners, reaching l.6 and reaching the top of the page; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, at the lateral sides, floral motifs and, in the middle, a depiction (red, yellow, light blue, green, white, rose and black) of Saint Michael with the sword and of king Sennacherib defeated.
Two legends, one (in black and in red) in the left upper margin and the other one (in black) in the centre of the picture.
Legend (left upper margin): ቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡, “Saint Michael”.
Legend (above the figure of the king): ዘከመ፡ ወድቀ፡ ሠናክሬም፡ ንጉሥ፡, “As the king Sennacherib fell down”.

- Fol. 59r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, pink and green) ornamental band at the incipit of Ps. 61, with two pendants at the corners reaching l.6; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, on the lateral sides, two floral motifs and, in the middle, a depiction (red, yellow, blue, violet, rose, black and white) of a man (on the left) with a balance in his hands and of another man (on the right) with a cotton white cloth covering his mouth (?). A legend (in black) is in the upper margin:
ሐሳውያን፡ ደቂቀ፡ እጓለ፡ እምሕያው፡ ይዔምፁ፡ መዳልወ። (cp. Ps. 62:9: ሐሳውያን፡ ደቂቀ፡ እጓለ፡ እምሕያው፡ ይዒምፁ፡ መዳልወ። እሙንቱሰ፡ እምከንቱ፡ ውስተ፡ ከንቱ፡ ክመ።).

- Fol. 70r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, pink and green) ornamental band, at the incipit of Ps. 71, with two lateral pendants at the bottom corners reaching l.3; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, on the lateral sides, two floral motifs and, in the middle, a depiction (red, yellow, blue, violet, green, white, pale rose and black) of king Salomon while being crowned by king Dawit and God. A legend (in black) is in the upper right margin:
ዘከመ፡ አንገሦ፡ ዳዊት፡ ለሰሎሞን፡, “How Dawit enthroned Sälomon”.

- Fol. 83r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, pink and green) ornamental band, at the incipit of Ps. 81, with four lateral pendants at the corners, reaching l.6 and reaching the top of the page; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, a depiction (red, yellow, blue, pale rose, white and black) of God among the priests (?).
A legend (in black) is in the upper part of the picture:
ዘለፋ፡ ካህና[ት፡] [መ]ኳንንት።

- Fol. 92v: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, pink, blue and green) ornamental band, at the incipit of Ps. 91, with two lateral pendants at the bottom corners reaching l.4; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, at the lateral sides, two floral motifs and, in the middle, a depiction (red, yellow, blue, green, pale rose, brown, black and white) of King Dawit playing the cithara. A legend (in black) is in the upper margin:
ዳዊት፡ ንጉሥ።, “King Dawit”.

- Fol. 99r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, blue, green and black) ornamental band, at the incipit of Ps. 101, with two lateral pendants at the bottom corners reaching l.6; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, at the lateral sides, two floral motifs and, in the middle, a depiction (yellow, red, pink, pale rose and black) of a hermit. A legend (in black) is in the upper margin:
ፀብእ፡ አጋንንትን፡ ድምፀ፡ አራዊት፡ ግሮማ፡ ሌለትን፡ ችሎ፡ ታግሦ፡ የሚኖር፡ ባሕታዊ።

- Fol. 113r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, light blue, green and black) ornamental band, at the incipit of Ps. 111, with two lateral pendants at the bottom corners reaching l.4; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, at the lateral sides, two floral motifs and, in the middle, a depiction (red, yellow, blue, violet, black and white) of a weeping man with a cross. A legend (in black) is in the upper left margin:
ብፁዕ፡ ብእሲ፡, “The blessed man”.

- Fol. 126v: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, green, black and white) ornamental band, at the incipit of Ps. 121, with two lateral pendants at the bottom corners reaching l.5; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, at the lateral sides, two floral motifs and, in the middle, a depiction (red, yellow, green blue, white and violet) of the Temple of Jerusalem. A legend (in black) is in the upper left margin of the picture:
[ኢየሩሳ]ሌም፡,“Jerusalem”.

- Fol. 130r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet and green) ornamental band, at the incipit of Ps. 131, with four lateral pendants at the corners, reaching l.4 and reaching the top of the page; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, in the middle, a depiction (red, yellow, green, blue, pale rose, violet, brown, black and white) of the priest Aaron (left side) and the prophet Nathan (right side) at the sides of a white tend.
Two legends (in black) are in the left and right upper margins.
Legend (left upper margin): አሮን፡ ካህንት።, “Priest Aaron”.
Legend (right upper margin): ናታን፡ ነቢይ።, “Prophet Nathan”.

- Fol. 137v: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, pink, green, black and white) ornamental band, at the incipit of Ps. 141, with two lateral pendants at the bottom corners reaching l.5 and l.6; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, at the lateral sides, two floral motifs and, in the middle, a depiction (red, yellow, green, pale rose, black and white) of King Dawit praying. A legend (in black) is in the upper margin of the picture:
ዘከመ፡ ጸለየ፡ ዳዊት፡, “How Dawit prayed”.

- Fol. 145r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, pink, light blue and green) ornamental band, at the incipit of Mäḫalǝyä näbiyat, with four lateral pendants at the corners, reaching l.4 and reaching the top of the page; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, a depiction (red, yellow, blue, green, violet, pale rose, white and black) of the Pharaoh drowning in the Red sea, defected by Moses with a rod (cp. Es. 15:4).
Three legends (in black) are in the upper margin and in the centre of the picture and in the right upper margin of the folio.
Legend (upper margin): ዘከመ፡ ተሠጥመ፡ ፈርዖን፡ ንጉሥ።, “How the king Pharaoh was drowned”.
Legend (centre): ባሕረ፡ ኤርትራ።, “The Red Sea”.
Legend (right upper margin): ሙሴ፡ ነቢይ፡, “Prophet Moses”.

- Fol. 160r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, pink, blue and green) ornamental band, at the incipit of Mäḫalǝyä mäḫalǝy, with two lateral pendants at the bottom corners reaching l.5; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, at the lateral sides, two floral motifs and, in the middle, a depiction (red, yellow, green, blue, pink, pale rose, black and white) of King Salomon. A legend (in black) in the right upper margin:
ሰሎሞን፡ ንጉሥ፡, “King Sälomon”.

- Fol. 169r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, pink, green, black and white) ornamental band, at the incipit of Wǝddase Maryam, with two pendants at the bottom corners reaching l.4, and one pendant from the central bottom part of the band, extending between the columns and reaching l.4.
At the top, at the lateral sides and in the middle, floral motifs. A legend (in black) is in the right upper margin of the band:
በትረ፡ አሮን።, “The stick of Aaron”.

list.item: - Chains of black and red nine dot asterisks with black lines above and below is at the end of most of the sections with a group of ten Psalms (esp. fols. 12v, 30v, 42v, 51v, 58v, 69v, 82v, 98v, 112v, 144v) in Text I (on fols. 21r, 92r, the chain is without lines). - In Text V, immediate corrections are indicated by two thin black (sometimes red) lines, above and below the word (e.g., fols. 177ra l.10, 179rb l.1, 180rb ls.3 and 9). - Crude notes in pen are on fol. 144v (in the text and after the additional note).

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: According to Additio 2, the Ms. was donated by Gäbrä Ṣǝyon and his wife Wälättä ʾAnänya.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
